title: Penalized Precision Matrix Estimation
text: Consider following setting: Gaussian graphical model (GGM) assumption: data Xn×pX_{n \times p} consists independent identically distributed samples X1,…,Xn∼Np(0,Σ)X_1, \dots, X_n \sim N_p(0,\Sigma). Disjoint group structure: pp variables can partitioned disjoint groups. Goal: Estimate precision matrix Ω=Σ−1=(ωij)p×p\Omega = \Sigma^{-1} = (\omega_{ij})_{p \times p}.

title: Penalized Precision Matrix Estimation
text: Ω̂=arg minΩ≻0{−logdet(Ω)+tr(SΩ)+αPindividual+(1−α)Pgroup}, \hat{\Omega} = \operatorname*{arg\,min}_{\Omega \succ 0} \left\{ -\log\det(\Omega) + \operatorname{tr}(S\Omega) + \alpha P_{\text{individual}} + (1-\alpha) P_{\text{group}} \right\},  : α∈[0,1]\alpha \[0,1] controls balance element-wise block-wise penalties. PindividualP_{\text{individual}} denotes element-wise individual penalty term. PgroupP_{\text{group}} denotes block-wise group penalty term.

title: Penalized Precision Matrix Estimation
text: package grasps estimates precision matrices using following penalties: Adaptive lasso (Zou 2006; Fan, Feng, Wu 2009) Pindividual=λ∑,j|ωij||vij|andPgroup=λ∑g,g′‖Ωgg′‖2‖Vgg′‖2 P_{\text{individual}} = \lambda\sum_{,j}\frac{\vert\omega_{ij}\vert}{\vert v_{ij}\vert} \quad\text{}\quad P_{\text{group}} = \lambda\sum_{g,g^\prime}\frac{\Vert\Omega_{gg^\prime}\Vert_2}{\Vert V_{gg^\prime}\Vert_2} Lasso (Tibshirani 1996; Friedman, Hastie, Tibshirani 2008) Pindividual=λ‖Ω‖1andPgroup=λ∑g,g′‖Ωgg′‖2 P_{\text{individual}} = \lambda\Vert\Omega\Vert_1 \quad\text{}\quad P_{\text{group}} = \lambda\sum_{g,g^\prime}\Vert\Omega_{gg^\prime}\Vert_2 Minimax concave penalty (MCP) (Zhang 2010) Pindividual=∑,jξλ,γ(|ωij|)andPgroup=∑g,g′ξλ,γ(‖Ωgg′‖2) P_{\text{individual}} = \sum_{,j}\xi_{\lambda,\gamma}(\vert\omega_{ij}\vert) \quad\text{}\quad P_{\text{group}} = \sum_{g,g^\prime}\xi_{\lambda,\gamma}(\Vert\Omega_{gg^\prime}\Vert_2) Smoothly clipped absolute deviation (SCAD) (Fan Li 2001; Fan, Feng, Wu 2009) Pindividual=∑,jψλ,γ(|ωij|)andPgroup=∑g,g′ψλ,γ(‖Ωgg′‖2) P_{\text{individual}} = \sum_{,j}\psi_{\lambda,\gamma}(\vert\omega_{ij}\vert) \quad\text{}\quad P_{\text{group}} = \sum_{g,g^\prime}\psi_{\lambda,\gamma}(\Vert\Omega_{gg^\prime}\Vert_2) : Ωgg′\Omega_{gg^\prime} denotes submatrix Ω\Omega rows group gg columns group g′g^\prime. norms defined ‖Ω‖1=∑,j|ωij|‖Ω‖2=‖Ω‖F=∑,j|ωij|2=tr(Ω⊤Ω). \Vert\Omega\Vert_1 = \sum_{,j} \vert \omega_{ij} \vert \quad\text{}\quad \Vert\Omega\Vert_2 = \Vert\Omega\Vert_F = \sqrt{\sum_{,j} \vert\omega_{ij}\vert^2} = \sqrt{\operatorname{tr}(\Omega^\top\Omega)}. λ>0\lambda > 0 regularization parameter. V=(vij)p×pV = (v_{ij})_{p \times p} matrix adaptive weights, estimate penalty = "lasso". ξλ,γ\xi_{\lambda,\gamma} penalty function MCP. ψλ,γ\psi_{\lambda,\gamma} penalty function SCAD.

what: Block-Band Matrix with Group Structure — blockband
title: Block-Band Matrix with Group Structure — blockband
text: Construct masked precision matrix entries kept within specified group neighborhoods. Optionally generate Gaussian samples resulting precision matrix.

title: Block-Band Matrix with Group Structure — blockband
code: blockband(   mat,   membership,   within.diag = TRUE,   neighbor.range = 1,   group.diag = NULL,   n,   seed = 1 )

title: Block-Band Matrix with Group Structure — blockband
text: mat p--p precision-like matrix specifying base matrix masked. membership integer vector specifying group membership. length membership must consistent dimension p. within.diag boolean (default = TRUE) specifying whether within-group blocks keep diagonal entries (.e., identity-like structure within group). neighbor.range integer (default = 1) specifying neighbor range, groups whose labels differ neighbor.range considered neighbors kept mask. group.diag integer vector (default = NULL) specifying within-group blocks keep diagonal-structure within.diag = FALSE. n integer (default = NULL) specifying sample size generating Gaussian data resulting precision matrix. NULL, data generated. seed integer (default = 1) specifying random seed reproducibility.

title: Block-Band Matrix with Group Structure — blockband
text: list containing: Omega masked precision matrix. Sigma covariance matrix, .e., inverse Omega. sparsity Proportion zero entries Omega. X n NULL, n--p matrix Gaussian observations sampled \(\mathcal{N}(0, \Sigma)\). membership integer vector specifying group membership.

what: SBM-based Gaussian Data with a Block-Structured Precision Matrix — gen_sbm_data
title: SBM-based Gaussian Data with a Block-Structured Precision Matrix — gen_sbm_data
text: Generate multivariate Gaussian data \(X \\mathbb{R}^{n \times p}\) whose precision matrix exhibits block (group) structure induced Stochastic Block Model (SBM).

title: SBM-based Gaussian Data with a Block-Structured Precision Matrix — gen_sbm_data
code: gen_sbm_data(   n,   p,   seed = 1,   block.sizes = NULL,   K = 3,   prob.mat = NULL,   within.prob = 0.25,   between.prob = 0.05,   weight.mat = NULL,   weight.dists = c("gamma", "unif"),   weight.paras = list(c(shape = 10000, rate = 100), c(min = 0, max = 5)),   min.eig = 0.1 )

title: SBM-based Gaussian Data with a Block-Structured Precision Matrix — gen_sbm_data
text: n integer specifying number sample size. p integer specifying number variables (dimensions). seed integer (default = 1) specifying random seed reproducibility. block.sizes integer vector (default = NULL) specifying size group. NULL, p variables divided evenly possible across K groups. K integer (default = 3) specifying number groups. Ignored block.sizes provided; K <- length(block.sizes). prob.mat K--K symmetric matrix (default = NULL) specifying Bernoulli rates. Element (,j) gives probability creating edge vertices groups j. NULL, matrix within.prob diagonal .prob -diagonal used. within.prob scalar [0,1] (default = 0.25) specifying probability creating edge vertices within group. .prob scalar [0,1] (default = 0.05) specifying probability creating edge vertices different groups. weight.mat p--p symmetric matrix (default = NULL) specifying edge weights. NULL, weights generated block-wise according weight.dists weight.paras. weight.dists character vector (default = c("gamma", "unif")) specifying distribution family block weights. length can : length = 1: distribution blocks. length = 2: first within-group blocks, second -group blocks. length = K + K(K-1)/2: full specification block (see Details). Accepted distributions (base R functions parentheses) include: "beta": Beta distribution (rbeta) "cauchy": Cauchy distribution (rcauchy). "chisq": Chi-squared distribution (rchisq). "exp": Exponential distribution (rexp). "f": F distribution (rf). "gamma": Gamma distribution (rgamma). "lnorm": Log normal distribution (rlnorm). "norm: Normal distribution (rnorm). "t": Student's t distribution (rt). "unif: Uniform distribution (runif). "weibull": Weibull distribution (rweibull). weight.paras list (default = list(c(shape = 1e4, rate = 1e2), c(min = 0, max = 5)) specifying parameters associated weight.dists. must follow length rules weight.dists. element named vector list suitable corresponding base R generator. min.eig scalar (default = 0.1) specifying minimum eigenvalue target precision matrix. diagonal shift ensures positive definiteness.

title: SBM-based Gaussian Data with a Block-Structured Precision Matrix — gen_sbm_data
text: list following components: Omega precision matrix SBM block structure. Sigma covariance matrix, .e., inverse Omega. sparsity Proportion zero entries Omega. X n--p matrix Gaussian observations sampled \(\mathcal{N}(0, \Sigma)\). membership integer vector specifying group membership.

title: SBM-based Gaussian Data with a Block-Structured Precision Matrix — gen_sbm_data
text: Within-group -group edges generated independently according Bernoulli distributions specified prob.mat, within.prob .prob prob.mat supplied. Conditional adjacency structure, edge weights sampled block-wise distributions specified weight.dists weight.paras. length weight.dists (weight.paras) determines weight distributions assigned: length = 1: distribution blocks; length = 2: first within-group blocks, second -group blocks; length = \(K + K(K - 1)/2\): full specification block. Block indexing weight specifications uses K within-group blocks indices 1, ..., K, followed K(K-1)/2 -group blocks ordered (1,2), (1,3), ..., (1,K), (2,3), ..., (K-1,K). weighted adjacency matrix symmetrized used precision matrix \(\Omega\). Since arbitrary block-structured weights may positive definite, diagonal adjustment applied ensure minimum eigenvalue \(\Omega\) least min.eig. covariance matrix computed \(\Sigma = \Omega^{-1}\), data matrix \(X\) generated multivariate normal distribution \(X \sim \mathcal{N}(0, \Sigma)\).

title: Groupwise Regularized Adaptive Sparse Precision Solution — grasps
code: grasps(   X,   n = nrow(X),   membership,   penalty,   diag.ind = TRUE,   diag.grp = TRUE,   diag.include = FALSE,   lambda = NULL,   alpha = NULL,   gamma = NULL,   nlambda = 10,   lambda.min.ratio = 0.01,   growiter.lambda = 30,   tol.lambda = 0.001,   maxiter.lambda = 50,   rho = 2,   tau.incr = 2,   tau.decr = 2,   nu = 10,   tol.abs = 1e-04,   tol.rel = 1e-04,   maxiter = 10000,   crit = "BIC",   kfold = 5,   ebic.tuning = 0.5 )

title: Groupwise Regularized Adaptive Sparse Precision Solution — grasps
text: X n--p data matrix sample size n dimension p. p--p sample covariance/correlation matrix dimension p. n integer (default = number columns X) specifying sample size. required input matrix X p--p sample covariance/correlation matrix dimension p. membership integer vector specifying group membership. length membership must consistent dimension p. penalty character string specifying penalty estimating precision matrix. Available options include: "adapt": adaptive lasso (Zou 2006; Fan et al. 2009) . "lasso": lasso (Tibshirani 1996; Friedman et al. 2008) . "mcp": minimax concave penalty (Zhang 2010) . "scad": smoothly clipped absolute deviation (Fan Li 2001; Fan et al. 2009) . diag.ind boolean (default = TRUE) specifying whether penalize diagonal elements. diag.grp boolean (default = TRUE) specifying whether penalize within-group blocks. diag.include boolean (default = FALSE) specifying whether include diagonal entries penalty within-group blocks diag.grp = TRUE. lambda grid non-negative scalars regularization parameter. default NULL, generates lambda sequence based nlambda lambda.min.ratio. alpha grid scalars [0,1] specifying parameter leveraging element-wise individual L1 penalty block-wise group L2 penalty. alpha 1 corresponds element penalty ; alpha 0 corresponds group penalty . default values sequence 0.05 0.95 increments 0.05. gamma scalar specifying hyperparameter chosen penalty.
